poem:
### The Change of Winds

Shadows of the past,  
class lines blur,  
in tangled tales  
where cultures clash—  
once, a chorus  
of clinking coins  
echoed in halls—  
now silenced,  
replaced by whispers  
of identity's call,  
in vibrant hues  
that paint  
the world anew.
